str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Probably from a primary verb eiro; peace; by implication, prosperity.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Optative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From hagios; to make holy, i.e. purify or consecrate; to venerate.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Perfect, complete, all. From holos and telos; complete to the end, i.e. Absolutely perfect.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Complete in every part, sound, perfect, entire. From holos and kleros; complete in every part, i.e. Perfectly sound.
Wind, breath, spirit.
From psucho; breath, i.e. spirit, abstractly or concretely.
And, even, also, namely.
Body, flesh; the body of the Church. From sozo; the body, used in a very wide application, literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Aorist Optative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From teros; to guard, i.e. To note; by implication, to detain; by extension, to withhold; by extension, to withhold.
Blamelessly. Adverb from amemptos; faultlessly.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the present participle of pareimi; a being near, i.e. Advent; physically, aspect.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
